definition: woven mat/seat/banquet/place in a democratic assembly/classifier for banquets, conversations etc

sentences.english: Zargany has taken a leave of absence amid a dispute with the region's provincial council.
sentences.chinese: 薩爾曼省長在當地的一次省級議會上請假缺席。

sentences.english: Missing three tests results in an automatic two-year ban.
sentences.chinese: 缺席三次藥檢的結果是自動禁賽兩年。

sentences.english: He made up a story to explain his absence.
sentences.chinese: 他編造謊言爲他的缺席開脫。

sentences.english: He absented himself from a meeting yesterday.
And all those absent in Nangang are important players.
sentences.chinese: 而且南鋼缺席的又都是主力隊員。

sentences.english: The string quartet was calling, and anyway it would have been bad manners.
sentences.chinese: 絃樂四重奏在召喚，缺席怎麼說都太失禮了。

sentences.english: And Yi did a great job off the bench, after missing 24 games.
sentences.chinese: 在缺席24場比賽後，阿聯打出了一場好球。

sentences.english: The European Union, meanwhile, is largely absent from this debate.
sentences.chinese: 同時，歐盟很大程度上是缺席這場辯論的。

sentences.english: John didn't have a good excuse for his absence so he made up one.
sentences.chinese: 約翰無故缺席，因此他編了一個理由。

sentences.english: You will be in the danger of failing the course if you exceed four absences.
sentences.chinese: 如果你缺席超過四次，這個科目你將有被當掉的危險。

sentences.english: She attended every twice-weekly session of the group.
sentences.chinese: 她準時參加寫作組每週兩次的會議，從不缺席。

sentences.english: Noticeably absent is the role of Team Leader; the team is expected to self-organize.
sentences.chinese: 團隊領導這個角色明顯缺席，這要求團隊做到自組織。

sentences.english: But the absence of men is no accident.
sentences.chinese: 然而男人的缺席並非偶然。

sentences.english: Kevin-Prince Boateng is back in action for AC Milan after more than two months out with injury.
sentences.chinese: 在兩個多月的因傷缺席後，博阿滕終於復出。

sentences.english: You get demerits if you miss a meeting .
sentences.chinese: 如果你缺席會議，會被記過的。

sentences.english: We're joining with dads across the country to do something about father absence.
sentences.chinese: 我們聯合全國各地的父親一起做一些父親缺席的事情。

definition: to come back out of retirement/to get involved again after having withdrawn
to compete/to take part (in a sports event)
to have no opportunity/no way (of doing sth)/no chance/no connection/not placed (in a competition)/(in pop lyrics) no chance of love, no place to be together etc
on stage/to go on stage/to take the field
(of a performer) to come onto the stage to perform/(of an athlete) to enter the arena to compete/(fig.) to enter the scene (e.g. a new product)/(of an examinee etc) to leave the venue
to leave in the middle of the play/(fig.) to leave before the matter is concluded
to go on stage/fig. to appear on the scene/used in advertising to mean new product
poised for battle/to square up for a fight
